newsitem.title: UK: Hall of Fame delays UK AIM market flotation.
newsitem.headline: Hall of Fame delays UK AIM market flotation.

text.p: UK soccer exhibition operator, Hall of Fame Holdings Plc, on Friday put on hold its planned flotation after an approach from unnamed third parties about other possible funding options, market sources said.

Shares in Hall of Fame were due to start trading on Friday on the London Stock Exchange's Alternative Investment Market (AIM). But now the company was unlikely to make its debut before early to mid-July, sources close to the company said.
Directors at Hall of Fame were unavailable for comment on the nature of the approach from the third parties.
Hall of Fame plans to build and manage an exhibition on British soccer in the Trocadero centre in central London.
Announcing its flotation in May, the company said it hoped to raise 3.7 million stg from the flotation to fund the development of the exhibition.
